code: .da_where_clause_get(   .clauses = list(),   .vtype = NULL,   .ftype = NULL,   .material = NULL,   .salesorg = NULL,   .scope_matl = FALSE,   .scope_sorg = FALSE,   .cm_min = NULL,   .cm_max = NULL,   .step_min = NULL,   .step_max = NULL,   .lagg_min = NULL,   .lagg_max = NULL,   .con = NULL )

title: Build a SQL WHERE Clause with Scope Materials ‚Äî .da_where_clause_get
text: .clauses list existing clauses (character strings). empty, "TRUE" added initial condition. .material Character vector. list materials filter . NULL, material-based filter applied. .salesorg Character vector. list sales organizations filter . NULL, sales organization-based filter applied. .scope_matl Logical. TRUE, restricts query materials within scope definition using CTE. .scope_sorg Logical. TRUE, restricts query sales organizations within scope definition. .cm_min Character. Minimum calendar month (format: YYYYMM). NULL, lower bound applied. .cm_max Character. Maximum calendar month (format: YYYYMM). NULL, upper bound applied. .step_min Numeric. Minimum step value filter . NULL, uses default package-defined constant STEP_MIN. .step_max Numeric. Maximum step value filter . NULL, uses default package-defined constant STEP_MAX. .lagg_min Numeric. Minimum lag value filter . NULL, uses default package-defined constant LAGG_MIN. .lagg_max Numeric. Maximum lag value filter . NULL, uses default package-defined constant LAGG_MAX. .con database connection object. Required safely parameterizing SQL queries using glue::glue_sql.

title: Build a SQL WHERE Clause with Scope Materials ‚Äî .da_where_clause_get
text: character string representing SQL clause.

title: Build a SQL WHERE Clause with Scope Materials ‚Äî .da_where_clause_get
text: function constructs SQL clause : Ensuring initial condition "TRUE" clauses exist .clauses. Appending conditions .material, .salesorg, scope definitions (.scope_matl, .scope_sorg). Adding conditions calendar month (.cm_min, .cm_max), step values (.step_min, .step_max), lag values (.lagg_min, .lagg_max). Optionally constructing Common Table Expression (CTE) scope materials .scope_matl = TRUE. Scope-based filters applied using pre-defined Common Table Expressions (CTEs).

title: Build a SQL WHERE Clause with Scope Materials ‚Äî .da_where_clause_get
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Build a basic WHERE clause where_clause <- .da_where_clause_get(   .material = c("MAT001", "MAT002"),   .salesorg = c("SORG001"),   .scope_matl = TRUE,   .cm_min = "202101",   .cm_max = "202312",   .step_min = -100,   .step_max = 100 )  print(where_clause) } # }

title: calculate forecast accuracy metrics ‚Äî pa_model_accuracy
text: function calculates forecast accuracy metrics merging actual forecast data, deriving error-based metrics Absolute Percentage Error (APE), returning detailed `data.table` computed values.

title: calculate forecast accuracy metrics ‚Äî pa_model_accuracy
calculate forecast accuracy metrics ‚Äî pa_model_accuracy
text: .tab `data.table` containing input data least columns: `VTYPE`, `FTYPE`, `SALESORG`, `PLANT`, `MATERIAL`, `CALMONTH`, `Q`, optionally `STEP`. .act_ftype integer specifying `FTYPE` value actual data. Defaults `1`. .fct_ftype integer specifying `FTYPE` value forecast data. Defaults `2`.

title: calculate forecast accuracy metrics ‚Äî pa_model_accuracy
text: `data.table` containing merged actual (`ACT`) forecast (`FCT`) data along following derived columns: - `E`  : Error (`ACT - FCT`) - `E2` : Squared Error (`E^2`) - `AE` : Absolute Error (`abs(E)`) - `APE`: Academic Percentage Error (`100 * AE / ACT`) - `APA`: Academic Percentage Accuracy (`100 - APE`) - `EPE`: Ecotone Percentage Error (`100 * AE / FCT`) - `EPA`: Ecotone Percentage Accuracy (`100 - EPE`) - `APB`: Absolute Percentage Bias (`100 * E / ACT`) - `EPB`: Ecotone Percentage Bias (`100 * E / FCT`)

title: calculate forecast accuracy metrics ‚Äî pa_model_accuracy
text: function performs following steps: 1. Subsets input `data.table` actual (`ACT`) forecast (`FCT`) data based    `VTYPE` `FTYPE` values. 2. Merges subsets using full outer join keys: `SALESORG`, `PLANT`, `MATERIAL`,    `CALMONTH`. 3. Replaces `NA` values `ACT` `FCT` columns `0`. 4. Computes derived columns (e.g., `E`, `AE`, `APE`) described `@return` section.

title: calculate forecast accuracy metrics ‚Äî pa_model_accuracy
code: library(data.table)  # Sample data .tab <- data.table(   VTYPE = c("010", "060", "010", "060"),   FTYPE = c(1, 2, 1, 2),   SALESORG = c("A", "A", "B", "B"),   PLANT = c("P1", "P1", "P2", "P2"),   MATERIAL = c("M1", "M1", "M2", "M2"),   CALMONTH = c("202301", "202301", "202302", "202302"),   Q = c(100, 120, 200, 190),   STEP = c(1, 1, 1, 1) )  # Calculate accuracy metrics result <- pa_model_accuracy(.tab) print(result) #> Key: <SALESORG, PLANT, MATERIAL, CALMONTH> #>    SALESORG  PLANT MATERIAL CALMONTH  STEP  MODEL   ACT   FCT     E    E2    AE #>      <char> <char>   <char>   <char> <num> <char> <num> <num> <num> <num> <num> #> 1:        A     P1       M1   202301     1   <NA>   100   120   -20   400    20 #> 2:        B     P2       M2   202302     1   <NA>   200   190    10   100    10 #>      APE   APA       EPE      EPA   APB        EPB #>    <num> <num>     <num>    <num> <num>      <num> #> 1:    20    80 16.666667 83.33333   -20 -16.666667 #> 2:     5    95  5.263158 94.73684     5   5.263158
